Map generator module

This module genuinely hurts my eyes, so here is your trigger-warning for magic value, hardcoded SVG and many more. The reasoning behind generating a SCG file on the fly is, so that you can dynamically add location markers/pins and rectangle as overlays for clickable areas (because who needs to visualise the <area> tag anyways... right?).

Imports

client, locations, globals

Types

Layer[T] = object
  name*: string
  opacity*: float = 1.0
  shapes*: seq[T]
Inkscape layer object 
Rect = object
  id*: string
  x*, y*, width*, height*: float
  ry*, rx*: float = 0.0
  fill*: string = "#1a1a1aff"
  stroke*: string = "#1a1a1aff" ## Does this value even do something? I do not know...
Rectangle overlay object

Consts

svgExportPath: string = "resources/images/map.svg"
Where the modified map is exported to

Procs

proc `$`(layer: Layer): string
Stringifies the layer object to a SVG layer 
proc `$`(rect: Rect): string {....raises: [ValueError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Stringifies the rect object to a SVG rectangle 
proc generateSvg() {....raises: [IOError, ValueError], tags: [WriteIOEffect],
                     forbids: [].}
External proc to generate new, modified SVG file
